rComments: Her lectures were not useful.  The way she structured the class was not helpful, the textbook was alright.  Homework assignments were long.  Her exams were very long.

She is an okay teacher just remember to read the book because it's easy to get away with not doing it for homework. Homework can get tricky math-wise, but it's nothing yahoo answers and a subsequent question to your TA can't solve.
I liked space, before I took this class. Rebecca is so absorbed in her own research and life and just teaches becasue she has to, this is NOT an easy GE! Though I did like using the iclicker

Overall, a very brilliant woman with a bad class structure. The book doesn't flow well with the lectures, yet it is imperative that you read it if you want to understand the material. Midterms/Final are pretty easy but I didn't feel like I learned very much in the end. The class wasn't as enriching as I had expected.

She went really fast during lecture, and I had to read the textbook to fully understand concepts. Midterms are easy and so is final. Pretty basic stuff on the tests. Everything is very basic, but nonetheless interesting.

She knows her stuff but definitely goes too fast for most of the class. Once she covers it, she expects you to know it, which is an impossible expectation. Textbook does not flow well with class lectures, as confirmed by the T.A.s. Midterms have been pretty easy, but class isn't as interesting or fun as I had hoped.
straight forward, generous hw and absence policy, enjoys answering questions, sometimes lets you out early, not super strict but knows how to control the class

easy class overall. material is fairly straight forward, just keep up with the readings. even if you don't, the curve on tests is HUGE. also go to class because of in-class clicker quizzes (25%) and no hw yay. rebecca is okay, raja is better but they switch off lecturing so doesn't matter which you get really. def take if you like astro or need a Q

She's easy to understand if you know basic physics. If not, she might seem to go a bit fast, but she's always willing to explain. She knows her stuff and is great at using examples to explain astronomy concepts. An easy class -- just take decent notes.

She's a really awesome, down-to-earth lady, but she goes over material really quickly. If you just raise your hand and ask her to slow down or go over something again though, she'll do it no problem. overall an easy class and if you at least take accurate notes and do the practice midterms you should be fine!

She's really organized and helpful. A lot of people said she talked too fast, but I thought the pace as perfect. I didn't get as bored in lecture as I usually do. Also, if you speak up about an issue, she'll accommodate you. She's not super funny, but she does joke a little.
She's so smart and tries really hard to get the points across to students but sometimes she goes too fast. Got to give her credit for at least trying.
